Speaker: {f:5:Lambdadelta}
Steam (ST): "You're right. Without that kid, this game might not have reached its conclusion. Enemies and allies are the bare minimum you need for a game."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não posso realmente ouvi‐los, ......mas sinto que todos ainda estão no hall, se divertindo muito.

Umineko Project (UP): ......It's what I've wanted the whole time, ......but I've never tried to take the first step.

Umineko Project (UP): I'll go to where everyone is.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'll go to where everyone is.

Umineko Project (UP): My head still feels hazy, ......so there aren't any complicated thoughts in my mind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My head still feels hazy, ......so there aren't any complicated thoughts in my mind.

Umineko Project (UP): But that's okay. It's okay if my head's empty.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But that's okay. It's okay if my head's empty.

Umineko Project (UP): I'll be together with everyone. I'll go to where they are. ......That's all that matters.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'll be together with everyone. I'll go to where they are. ......That's all that matters.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我要和大家在一起。到和大家一起的地方。……这样就足够了。

Steam (ST): I got up from the sofa and put on my shoes.
Umineko Project (UP): I got up from the sofa and put on my shoes, which had been placed neatly for me to find.

Umineko Project (UP): Let's go. To where everyone is.

Umineko Project (UP): The parlor door was shut.

Umineko Project (UP): ......I tried to open it, but maybe because of my clumsiness, I couldn't get it open.

Steam (ST): I kept on alternating between turning the lock and roughly twisting the doorknob.
Umineko Project (UP): I kept on alternating between turning the lock and roughly twisting the doorknob.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I kept on alternating between turning the lock and roughly twisting the doorknob.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 私は何度もがちゃがちゃと回してはドアノブを激しく捻る。

Steam (ST): I began to get irritated, wondering why they'd locked me away behind such an inconvenient door.
Umineko Project (UP): I started to become genuinely annoyed, wondering why they'd locked me away behind such an inconvenient door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I began to get irritated, wondering why they'd locked me away behind such an inconvenient door.
PC Japanese (JP): だんだん、どうしてこんな不便な扉を閉めて私を閉じ込めたのかと、苛立ちさえ覚えてきた。
Russian (RU): Я начала злиться, задаваясь вопросом, почему они заперли меня за такой неудобной дверью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu comecei a ficar genuinamente irritada, me perguntando por que eles haviam me trancado atrás de uma porta tão inconveniente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 逐漸地，就算是焦躁的我也開始想，為什麼要用這種不方便開關的門來把我關在裡面了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 逐渐地，就算是焦躁的我也开始想，为什么要用这种不方便开关的门来把我关在里面了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Iniziai ad irritarmi, chiedendomi perché mi avessero chiusa dietro una porta così stupida.

Steam (ST): Eventually, I ran out of patience and pounded hard on the door, but that noise didn't bring anyone to me.
Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, I ran out of patience and pounded hard on the door, but that noise didn't bring anyone over.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, I ran out of patience and pounded hard on the door, but that noise didn't bring anyone over.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente, eu perdi a paciência e soquei a porta com força, mas o barulho não fez com que ninguém viesse até mim.

Steam (ST): Why am I locked up in a place like this, all alone?!
Umineko Project (UP): Why am I locked up in a place like this, all alone?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Why am I locked up in a place like this, all alone?!

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché sono chiusa in un posto del genere, tutta sola?!

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E todos estão se divertindo na festa, no hall aqui do lado...!

Umineko Project (UP): Wind? Inside......?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Wind? Inside......?
PC Japanese (JP): 室内で、風……？
Russian (RU): Ветер? В помещении?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Vento? Aqui dentro......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在屋裡，有風……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在屋里，有风……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Vento? Dentro...?

Steam (ST): I turned around...to find the window curtain waving about.
Umineko Project (UP): I turned around......to find the window curtain waving about.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 振り返ると、……窓のカーテンが大きく揺らいでいた。
Russian (RU): Я обернулась...... и увидела окно с развивающейся занавеской.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu me virei......e vi as cortinas da janela balançando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 回頭一看，……窗簾正大幅地擺動著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 回头一看，……窗帘正大幅地摆动着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi girai... per vedere la tenda che ondeggiava.

Steam (ST): There was a sound like scraping or crying.
Umineko Project (UP): There was a high‐pitched squeal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was a sound like scraping or crying.
PC Japanese (JP): キィと擦るような、泣くような音。
Russian (RU): Слышался звук, напоминающий царапанье или плач.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um som agudo que guinchava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 發出唧唧的聲響，好像哭聲一樣的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 发出唧唧的声响，好像哭声一样的声音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): C'era un suono simile ad un lamento.

Steam (ST): ...At some point, the double window had opened outwards toward the darkness.
Umineko Project (UP): ......At some point, the double window had opened outwards toward the darkness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……いつの間にか、観音開きの窓が、闇夜に向かって開いていたのだ。
Russian (RU): ......В какой‐то момент двойное окно открылось в темноту снаружи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em determinado momento, a janela dupla se abriu na direção da escuridão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不知何時，對開的窗戶，向著黑夜打開了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不知何时，对开的窗户，向着黑夜打开了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ad un certo punto, la finestra si era aperta all'esterno verso l'oscurità.

Steam (ST): The icy wind that came through it...told me that this window was the only exit from this room.
Umineko Project (UP): The icy wind that came through it......told me that this window was the only exit from this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The icy wind that came through it......told me that this window was the only exit from this room.
PC Japanese (JP): そこから入ってくる冷たい風が、……この窓だけが、この部屋からの唯一の出口であると教えてくれた。
Russian (RU): Через него проходил ледяной ветер...... говорящий мне, что это окно — единственный выход из комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O vento gélido veio através dela......dizendo que aquela janela era a única forma de sair deste cômodo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從那裡吹入的冷風告訴我，……只有這扇窗戶，是這間屋子的唯一出口。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从那里吹入的冷风告诉我，……只有这扇窗户，是这间屋子的唯一出口。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il vento gelido che vi passava attraverso... mi diceva che questa finestra era la sola uscita da questa stanza.

Steam (ST): Huh?
Umineko Project (UP): Huh?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Huh?
PC Japanese (JP): え？
Russian (RU): Э?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hã?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 誒？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 诶？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): [=UP]

Steam (ST): I suddenly realized that the darkness beyond the open window was glaring at me, and my heart leapt.
Umineko Project (UP): I suddenly realized that the darkness beyond the open window was glaring at me, and my tiny heart leapt.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I suddenly realized that the darkness beyond the open window was glaring at me, and my heart leapt.
PC Japanese (JP): 開いた窓の外の闇夜が、私を睨んでいることにたった今、気付き、私の小さな心臓が跳ね上がる。
Russian (RU): Я вдруг поняла, что тьма за открытым окном пристально смотрит на меня, и моё сердце подскочило.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De repente, eu percebi que a escuridão para além da janela estava me olhando e meu coração disparou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛剛察覺到，窗外的黑夜正窺視著我，令我小小的心臟跳動加速。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚刚察觉到，窗外的黑夜正窥视着我，令我小小的心脏跳动加速。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Pensai all'improvviso che l'oscurità oltre la finestra mi stava osservando, e il mio cuore sobbalzò.

Steam (ST): *jingle* ...A cute sound rang out.
Umineko Project (UP): ......A cute jingling sound rang out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): *jingle* ...A cute sound rang out.
PC Japanese (JP): コロン、と、……可愛い音が鳴った。
Russian (RU): *звон* ......Раздался милый звук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Um adorável som reverberou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鐺啷，地，……響起了可愛的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 铛啷，地，……响起了可爱的声音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): *jingle*... Si sentì un suono carino.

Steam (ST): I finally understood. That sound was a cat's bell.
Umineko Project (UP): I finally understood. That sound was a cat's bell.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I finally understood. That sound was a cat's bell.
PC Japanese (JP): ようやく理解する。その音は、猫の鈴。
Russian (RU): Я наконец поняла. Звенел кошачий колокольчик.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu finalmente entendi. Era o som do sininho de um gato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我終於理解。這個聲音是，貓鈴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我终于理解。这个声音是，猫铃。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Finalmente capii. Era il suono di un campanellino di un gatto.

Steam (ST): The glaring emerald eyes in the darkness...were those of a cat standing in the open window.
Umineko Project (UP): The glaring emerald eyes in the darkness......were those of a cat standing in the open window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The glaring emerald eyes in the darkness......were those of a cat standing in the open window.
PC Japanese (JP): 睨む暗闇のエメラルドの目は、……開いた窓ににたたずむ、猫の目だったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 睨む暗闇のエメラルドの目は、……開いた窓にたたずむ、猫の目だったのだ。
Russian (RU): Яркие изумрудные глаза в темноте...... принадлежали кошке, стоящей на открытом окне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os olhos esmeralda que encaravam da escuridão......pertencia ao gato que estava diante da janela aberta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在黑暗中窺視的祖母綠之眼，……那是佇立在打開的窗邊的，貓的眼睛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在黑暗中窥视的祖母绿之眼，……那是伫立在打开的窗边的，猫的眼睛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Gli occhi verde smeraldo che osservavano nell'oscurità... erano quelli di un gatto, seduto sulla finestra aperta.

Steam (ST): Its pitch-black, luxuriant fur left only the eyes visible, blending in with the darkness easily.
Umineko Project (UP): Its pitch‐black, luxuriant fur blended in with the darkness easily, leaving only the eyes visible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Its pitch-black, luxuriant fur left only the eyes visible, blending in with the darkness easily.
PC Japanese (JP): その漆黒の上品な毛並みは、エメラルドの目だけを残し、闇夜に姿を溶かすには充分だった。
Russian (RU): Её кромешно чёрный, пышный мех оставлял видимыми только глаза, легко сливаясь с тьмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu pelo negro e exuberante se misturava facilmente com a escuridão, deixando apenas seus olhos visíveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那漆黑而高貴的毛色，可以完全融入黑夜，僅剩祖母綠一般的眼眸。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那漆黑而高贵的毛色，可以完全融入黑夜，仅剩祖母绿一般的眼眸。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il suo pelo nero come la pece lasciava intravedere solo gli occhi, fondendolo all'oscurità.

Steam (ST): ...Did the Ushiromiya family own a cat? It has a bell on it, so it can't be a stray. It's a cat someone owns.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Did the Ushiromiya family own a cat?{n}It has a bell on it, so it can't be a stray. It's a cat someone owns.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Did the Ushiromiya family own a cat? It has a bell on it, so it can't be a stray. It's a cat someone owns.
PC Japanese (JP): ……右代宮家で猫なんて、飼っていたっけ。鈴がついているなら、野良じゃない。誰かの飼い猫だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……右代宮家で猫なんて、飼っていたっけ。{n}鈴がついているなら、野良じゃない。誰かの飼い猫だ。
Russian (RU): ......Разве у семьи Уширомия есть кошка?{n}На ней висит колокольчик, поэтому она не может быть бездомной. Это чья‐то кошка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A família Ushiromiya tem um gato?{n}Ele tinha um sininho, então não podia ser um gato de rua. É o gato de alguém.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……右代宮家，有養過貓嗎？{n}既然系有鈴鐺，就不是野貓。是家養的貓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……右代宫家，有养过猫吗？{n}既然系有铃铛，就不是野猫。是家养的猫。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La famiglia Ushiromiya aveva un gatto? Ha un collare, quindi non è selvaggio. È il gatto di qualcuno.

Steam (ST): At any rate, the cat was standing by the window...and staring straight at me.
Umineko Project (UP): At any rate, the cat was standing by the window......and staring straight at me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At any rate, the cat was standing by the window......and staring straight at me.
PC Japanese (JP): とにかく、その猫が窓辺に立ち、……私をじぃっと見つめていた。
Russian (RU): Так или иначе, она стояла на окне...... и смотрела прямо на меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seja de quem for, o gato estava parado na janela......olhando diretamente para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總之，這只貓站在窗邊，……直直地盯著我看。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总之，这只猫站在窗边，……直直地盯着我看。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In ogni caso, il gatto era vicino alla finestra... e guardava proprio me.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………あなたはだぁれ……？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Chi... sei tu...?"

Steam (ST): Of course, the cat didn't answer my question.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, the cat didn't answer my question.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 私は問い掛けるが、……猫が返事をするわけもない。
Russian (RU): Естественно, на мой вопрос кошка не ответила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, o gato não respondeu a minha pergunta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我這樣問到，……不過貓不可能會回答。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我这样问到，……不过猫不可能会回答。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, il gatto non mi rispose.

Steam (ST): I didn't think it was a cute cat, ...but I thought it might be trying to tell me something, ...so I approached it slowly.
Umineko Project (UP): I didn't think it was a cute cat, ......but I thought it might be trying to tell me something, ......so I approached it slowly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't think it was a cute cat, ......but I thought it might be trying to tell me something, ......so I approached it slowly.
PC Japanese (JP): 可愛い猫とは思わなかったけれど、……私に何か伝えることがあるのかもしれないと思い、……ゆっくりと近付く。
Russian (RU): Я не посчитала её милой...... но подумала, что она пытается мне что‐то сказать...... и медленно подошла к ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não achei ele um gato fofo, ......mas senti que ele estava tentando me dizer alguma coisa, ......por isso me aproximei lentamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然不覺得是只很可愛的貓，……不過我覺得它似乎是要向我傳達些什麼，……便慢慢地靠近。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然不觉得是只很可爱的猫，……不过我觉得它似乎是要向我传达些什么，……便慢慢地靠近。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non pensavo che fosse un bel gatto... ma credevo che stesse cercando di dirmi qualcosa... quindi mi avvicinai lentamente.

Steam (ST): As I did, the cat did an about-face, turning its back to me.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, the cat did an about face, turning its back to me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, the cat did an about face, turning its back to me.
PC Japanese (JP): すると猫は、くるりと背を向ける。
Russian (RU): Она развернулась, отвернувшись от меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, o gato deu as costas para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是那貓把身子轉了過去，背對著我。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是那猫把身子转了过去，背对着我。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Allora, il gatto si girò, dandomi le spalle.

Steam (ST): Then, it turned its head to look at me, almost as though it was telling me to follow it, and it leapt down into the darkness, leaving the jingle of its bell behind.
Umineko Project (UP): It then turned its head to look at me, almost as though it was telling me to follow it, and it leapt down into the darkness, leaving the jingle of its bell behind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, it turned its head to look at me, almost as though it was telling me to follow it, and it leapt down into the darkness, leaving the jingle of its bell behind.
PC Japanese (JP): そして私に振り返り、まるでついてこいとでも言うように、コロンという鈴の音を残して、闇夜へ飛び降りる。
Russian (RU): Затем кошка повернула голову и взглянула на меня, будто говоря мне следовать за ней, а потом прыгнула в темноту ниже, позвенев колокольчиком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele então virou a cabeça na minha direção, quase como se estivesse dizendo para segui‐lo e saltou na escuridão, deixando o som de seu sininho para trás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之後又向我轉過頭來，像是在說讓我跟它走，留下鐺啷的鈴響，向著黑夜跳了下去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之后又向我转过头来，像是在说让我跟它走，留下铛啷的铃响，向着黑夜跳了下去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, girò la testa per guardarmi, come se mi stesse dicendo di seguirlo, e si infilò nell'oscurità, lasciandosi dietro uno scampanellio.

Steam (ST): When I peeked out the window, I saw the cat waiting for me under the pounding rain.
Umineko Project (UP): When I peeked out the window, I saw the cat waiting for me under the pounding rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I peeked out the window, I saw the cat waiting for me under the pounding rain.
PC Japanese (JP): 窓の外を覗くと、私が来るのを待つように、猫は雨に打たれるまま、そこにいた。
Russian (RU): Выглянув в окно, я увидела, как она ждёт меня под проливным дождём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando espiei do lado de fora da janela, eu vi o gato esperando por mim sob a chuva torrencial.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 向窗外一看，那貓像是在等我過來似的，被雨淋著站在那裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 向窗外一看，那猫像是在等我过来似的，被雨淋着站在那里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando sbirciai fuori dalla finestra, vidi il gatto che mi aspettava sotto la pioggia scrosciante.

Steam (ST): ...I finally realized.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I finally realized.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……私はようやく気付く。
Russian (RU): ......Я наконец поняла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu finalmente entendi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我這才察覺到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我这才察觉到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Finalmente capii.

Steam (ST): This window was the only exit out of this closed room parlor. The cat must have come to tell me that.
Umineko Project (UP): This window was the only exit out of this locked‐room parlor.{n}That cat had surely come to tell me that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This window was the only exit out of this closed room parlor. That cat has surely come to tell me that.
PC Japanese (JP): この密室の客間から出る、唯一の出口がこの窓だった。猫は、私にそれを教えに来てくれたに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この密室の客間から出る、唯一の出口がこの窓だった。{n}猫は、私にそれを教えに来てくれたに違いない。
Russian (RU): Это окно — единственный выход из закрытой гостиной.{n}Кошка наверняка пришла сказать мне об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A janela era a única saída do quarto fechado que se tornou esta sala.{n}Esse gato só pode ter vindo para me dizer isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從客廳這個密室出去的，唯一的出口就是這扇窗戶。{n}貓一定是，為了告訴我這個才來的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从客厅这个密室出去的，唯一的出口就是这扇窗户。{n}猫一定是，为了告诉我这个才来的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa finestra era la sola uscita da questa stanza chiusa. Quel gatto è venuto di sicuro per dirmelo.

Steam (ST): The longer I keep standing around here, the longer the cat will have to wait in the rain.
Umineko Project (UP): The longer I keep standing around here, the longer the cat will have to wait in the rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The longer I keep standing around here, the longer the cat will have to wait in the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): いつまでも私がここでぼーっとしていると、猫はいつまでも雨に打たれてしまう。
Russian (RU): Чем дольше я здесь стою, тем дольше кошке придётся ждать под дождём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quanto mais eu ficar aqui, mais tempo o gato vai ficar esperando na chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我要是總在這裡發呆，貓就會一直被雨淋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我要是总在这里发呆，猫就会一直被雨淋。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Più rimango qui, più il gatto dovrà aspettare nella pioggia.

Steam (ST): That's no good. It'll catch cold.
Umineko Project (UP): That's no good. It'll catch cold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's no good. It'll catch cold.
PC Japanese (JP): いけない。風邪を引いちゃう。
Russian (RU): Так нельзя. Она простудится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não posso deixá‐lo assim. Ele vai pegar um resfriado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不好。這樣會感冒的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不好。这样会感冒的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non va bene. Si beccherà un raffreddore.

Steam (ST): I climbed up onto the windowsill and went out the window.
Umineko Project (UP): I climbed up onto the windowsill and went out the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I climbed up onto the windowsill and went out the window.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は窓枠によじ登り、そこから表へ出てる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 私は窓枠によじ登り、そこから表へ出る。
Russian (RU): Я забралась на подоконник и вышла через окно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu escalei o peitoril e saí pela janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我爬上窗沿，從這裡出到外面來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我爬上窗沿，从这里出到外面来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi arrampicai sul davanzale e uscii dalla finestra.

Steam (ST): The wind was strong, and the rain was cold, but I didn't get as wet as I'd thought I would. I might've been in the mansion's shadow.
Umineko Project (UP): The wind was strong, and the rain was cold, but I didn't get as wet as I'd thought I would.{n}I might have been in the mansion's shadow.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The wind was strong, and the rain was cold, but I didn't get as wet as I'd thought I would. I might have been in the mansion's shadow.
PC Japanese (JP): 風は強く雨も冷たいが、思ったほど体は濡れなかった。お屋敷の陰になっているせいかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 風は強く雨も冷たいが、思ったほど体は濡れなかった。{n}お屋敷の陰になっているせいかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Дул сильный ветер и шёл холодный дождь, но я не намокла так, как ожидала.{n}Я, наверное, была в тени особняка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O vento era forte e a chuva era fria, mas eu não fiquei molhada como imaginei.{n}Pode ser que eu estivesse na sombra da mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然風很強雨也很冷，但身體並未像想像中那樣被淋濕。{n}說不定是因為大屋給擋住了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然风很强雨也很冷，但身体并未像想像中那样被淋湿。{n}说不定是因为大屋给挡住了吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il vento era forte, e la pioggia ghiacciata, ma non mi bagnai così tanto come pensavo. Forse ero all'ombra della villa.

Steam (ST): When the cat saw that I was outside, it walked along the wall of the mansion as if guiding me.
Umineko Project (UP): When the cat saw that I was outside, it walked along the wall of the mansion as if guiding me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the cat saw that I was outside, it walked along the wall of the mansion as if guiding me.
PC Japanese (JP): 猫は、私が出てきたことを見届けると、先導するように、お屋敷の壁に沿って歩き出す。
Russian (RU): Увидев, что я снаружи, кошка пошла вдоль стены, словно ведя меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o gato viu que eu saí, ele caminhou próximo à parede da mansão, como se estivesse me guiando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貓看著我從屋裡出來，就像是在前領路一樣，沿著大屋的牆壁向前走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 猫看着我从屋里出来，就像是在前领路一样，沿着大屋的墙壁向前走去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando il gatto vide che ero fuori, camminò lungo il muro della villa come per guidarmi.

Steam (ST): It quickly disappeared into the blackness, but every now and then, it would turn around and set the bell jingling to let me know it was there.
Umineko Project (UP): It quickly disappeared into the blackness, but every now and then, it would turn around and set the bell jingling to let me know it was there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It quickly disappeared into the blackness, but every now and then, it would turn around and set the bell jingling to let me know it was there.
PC Japanese (JP): 闇の中にすぐに溶け込んでしまうが、時折、振り返り、鈴を鳴らすことで私に存在を教えてくれた。
Russian (RU): Она быстро канула во тьму, но то и дело поворачивалась и звенела колокольчиком, давая мне знать, что она там.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele rapidamente desapareceu na escuridão, mas de tempos em tempos, ele se virava e seu sino tinia, indicando que ele ainda estava ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它的身影很快就會融入黑暗之中，但它會時不時地回頭，讓鈴聲響起來告訴我它的位置。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它的身影很快就会融入黑暗之中，但它会时不时地回头，让铃声响起来告诉我它的位置。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sparì rapidamente nell'oscurità, ma ogni tanto si girava e lasciava suonare il campanellino per farmi sapere che era lì.

Steam (ST): Eventually, a window with light seeping out came into view.
Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, a window with light seeping out came into view.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, a window with light seeping out came into view.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、明かりが漏れている窓が見えてくる。
Russian (RU): В конце концов показалось окно с просачивающимся через него светом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Logo, eu pude ver a luz que escapava por uma das janelas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 終於，可以看到漏出光亮的窗戶了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 终于，可以看到漏出光亮的窗户了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In seguito, riuscii a vedere una finestra da cui usciva della luce.

Steam (ST): It was the window to the hall.
Umineko Project (UP): It was the window to the hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the window to the hall.
PC Japanese (JP): それはホールの窓だった。
Russian (RU): Окно зала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era a janela do hall.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是大廳的窗戶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是大厅的窗户。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era la finestra del salone.

Steam (ST): When I peeked inside, I saw everyone having a good time. I couldn't hear their voices, but they were all right there.
Umineko Project (UP): When I peeked inside, I saw everyone having a good time.{n}I couldn't hear their voices, but they were all right there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I peeked inside, I saw everyone having a good time. I couldn't hear their voices, but they were all right there.
PC Japanese (JP): 中を覗くと、みんなが楽しそうにしていた。声は聞こえないけれど、すぐそこにみんながいた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 中を覗くと、みんなが楽しそうにしていた。{n}声は聞こえないけれど、すぐそこにみんながいた。
Russian (RU): Заглянув туда, я увидела, как остальные хорошо проводят время.{n}Я не слышала голосов, но все они были там.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando espiei para dentro, eu vi todos se divertindo muito.{n}Não consegui ouvir as suas vozes, mas todos estavam bem ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 向裡面窺視，大家似乎都很開心。{n}雖然聽不到聲音，但大家就在眼前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 向里面窥视，大家似乎都很开心。{n}虽然听不到声音，但大家就在眼前。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando guardai all'interno, vidi tutti gli altri che si divertivano. Non potevo sentire le loro voci, ma erano tutti lì.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Open up...! Open up!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Open up...! Open up!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「開けて…！　開けてー！！」
Russian (RU): "Откройте!.. Откройте!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Abram...! Abram!!"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Aprite...! Aprite!!"

Steam (ST): I pounded on the window, but no one heard.
Umineko Project (UP): I pounded on the window, but no one heard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 私は窓はばんばんと叩くのだが、それは誰の耳にも届かない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 私は窓をばんばんと叩くのだが、それは誰の耳にも届かない。
Russian (RU): Я постучала по окну, но никто не услышал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu bati na janela, mas ninguém ouviu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我把窗戶敲得咚咚直響，但沒有任何人聽到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我把窗户敲得咚咚直响，但没有任何人听到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sbattei sulla finestra, ma nessuno sentiva.

Steam (ST): ...Maybe the window was really thick, or maybe it was just noisy inside. ...Or, it might have been so dark outside that I blended in with the darkness.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Maybe the window was really thick, or maybe it was just noisy inside. ......Or, it might have been so dark outside that even I blended in with the darkness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Maybe the window was really thick, or maybe it was just noisy inside. ......Or, it might have been so dark outside that I blended in with the darkness.
PC Japanese (JP): ……よほど窓が厚いのか、中が賑やかなのか。……あるいは、こちらが闇夜だから、私の姿も闇に溶け込んでしまっていて見えないのか。
Russian (RU): ......Возможно, окно было очень толстым, или же просто внутри было шумно. ......Или, может, снаружи было так темно, что я слилась с темнотой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Talvez o vidro fosse muito espesso, ou talvez estivesse muito barulhento lá dentro. ......Ou é possível que estivesse tão escuro na rua que até eu acabei me misturando à escuridão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……是因為窗戶太厚了，還是裡面太熱鬧了？……或者是因為，外面是黑夜，我的身影也融於黑暗之中無法看到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……是因为窗户太厚了，还是里面太热闹了？……或者是因为，外面是黑夜，我的身影也融于黑暗之中无法看到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Forse la finestra era davvero spessa, o forse c'era solo troppo rumore dentro. ... O forse era troppo buio fuori e mi confondevo nell'oscurità.

Steam (ST): In any event, no matter how much I hit the window, it didn't look as though anyone noticed.
Umineko Project (UP): In any event, no matter how much I hit the window, it didn't look as though anyone noticed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In any event, no matter how much I hit the window, it didn't look as though anyone noticed.
PC Japanese (JP): とにかく、いくら叩いても、誰も気付いてくれる様子はなかった。
Russian (RU): Во всяком случае, сколько бы я ни била по окну, никто не заметил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seja como for, não importa o quanto eu bata na janela, não parece que alguém vai me perceber.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總之，無論怎麼敲，似乎都沒有人注意到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总之，无论怎么敲，似乎都没有人注意到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In ogni caso, non importa quanto insistessi, sembrava che nessuno se ne accorgesse.

Steam (ST): By this point, my loneliness was giving way to anger. Why don't you notice me? Why did you lock me up in that room all alone?
Umineko Project (UP): By this point, my loneliness was giving way to anger. Why don't you notice me? Why did you lock me up in that room all alone?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By this point, my loneliness was giving way to anger. Why don't you notice me? Why did you lock me up in that room all alone?
PC Japanese (JP): ここまで来ると、寂しいという気持ちより、どうして私に気付いてくれないのか、どうして私だけをひとりぼっちにして、あんな部屋に閉じ込めていたのかと、怒りの感情の方が強くなってくる。
Russian (RU): К этому моменту одиночество уступило место гневу. Почему вы меня не замечаете? Почему заперли меня в той комнате совсем одну?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A essa altura, a minha solidão foi se transformando em raiva. Por que eles não me percebem? Por que me trancaram sozinha naquela sala?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 都到這裡了，比起寂寞的心情，為什麼沒有人注意到我，為什麼只有我是獨自一人被關在那間屋子裡，這種生氣的感情變得更強烈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 都到这里了，比起寂寞的心情，为什么没有人注意到我，为什么只有我是独自一人被关在那间屋子里，这种生气的感情变得更强烈。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A questo punto, la mia solitudine lasciava posto alla rabbia. Perché non mi notate? Perché mi avete rinchiusa in quella stanza tutta da sola?

Steam (ST): I've had enough. I'll get inside somehow and yell at everyone.
Umineko Project (UP): I've had enough.{n}I'll just get inside somehow and yell at everyone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I've had enough. I'll just get inside somehow and yell at everyone.
PC Japanese (JP): もう、いいもんっ。どこかから中に入って、みんなに怒ってやる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もう、いいもんっ。{n}どこかから中に入って、みんなに怒ってやる。
Russian (RU): С меня хватит.{n}Я просто как‐нибудь попаду туда и накричу на всех.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Já chega.{n}Vou dar um jeito de entrar e gritar com eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就這樣吧。{n}找地方進去，然後對大家發火。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就这样吧。{n}找地方进去，然后对大家发火。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ne ho abbastanza. Mi limiterò ad entrare in qualche modo e a sgridarli tutti.

Steam (ST): When the cat realized that I had given up knocking on the window, it led me onwards with another jingle.
Umineko Project (UP): When the cat realized that I had given up knocking on the window, it led me onwards with another jingle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the cat realized that I had given up knocking on the window, it led me onwards with another jingle.
PC Japanese (JP): 私が窓を叩くことに諦めたと悟ると、猫は再び鈴を鳴らして先導をする。
Russian (RU): Поняв, что я бросила стучать в окно, кошка повела меня дальше очередным звоном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o gato percebeu que eu tinha desistido de bater na janela, ele me guiou em frente com o som do seu sininho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 意識到我放棄敲擊窗戶後，貓再次讓鈴響動來領路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 意识到我放弃敲击窗户后，猫再次让铃响动来领路。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando il gatto si accorse che avevo smesso di sbattere sulla finestra, mi guidò oltre con un altro scampanellio.

Steam (ST): ...But just where is this cat going?
Umineko Project (UP): ......But just where is this cat going?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But just where is this cat going?
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも、猫はどこへ行こうと言うのだろう？
Russian (RU): ......Но куда она направляется?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas pra onde ele está indo?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，這貓是要上哪裡去啊？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，这猫是要上哪里去啊？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma dove sta andando questo gatto?

Steam (ST): I know it's following the wall of the mansion. But that's not the way to the front door.
Umineko Project (UP): I know it's following the wall of the mansion.{n}But that's not the way to the front door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I know it's following the wall of the mansion. But that's not the way to the front door.
PC Japanese (JP): お屋敷の壁に沿って進んでいるのはわかる。でも、玄関はそっちじゃないはずだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): お屋敷の壁に沿って進んでいるのはわかる。{n}でも、玄関はそっちじゃないはずだ。
Russian (RU): Я знаю, что она идёт вдоль стены особняка.{n}Но это не путь к парадной двери.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sei que está acompanhando a parede da mansão.{n}Mas a porta da frente não fica pra esse lado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我知道是在沿著大屋的牆壁走。{n}但是，玄關應該不是那邊啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我知道是在沿着大屋的墙壁走。{n}但是，玄关应该不是那边啊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): So che sta seguendo il muro della villa. Ma questa non è la strada per la porta principale.

Steam (ST): The front door might be locked.
Umineko Project (UP): The front door might be locked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The front door might be locked.
PC Japanese (JP): 玄関は閉まっているのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Парадная дверь может быть заперта.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A porta da frente pode estar trancada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說不定玄關也關著門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说不定玄关也关着门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Potrebbe essere chiusa.

Steam (ST): I'm sure the cat knows a way into the mansion...and is leading me there.
Umineko Project (UP): I'm sure the cat knows a place that I can get into the mansion from...and is leading me there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm sure the cat knows a place that I can get into the mansion from...and is leading me there.
PC Japanese (JP): きっと猫は、お屋敷の中に入れる場所を知っていて、そこへ私を案内してくれているに違いない。
Russian (RU): Я уверена, что кошка знает место, через которое можно попасть в особняк, и ведёт меня туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tenho certeza que ele sabe de um lugar pelo qual eu possa entrar na mansão...e está me levando até lá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一定這只貓是知道能進入大屋的地方，來帶領我到那裡去的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一定这只猫是知道能进入大屋的地方，来带领我到那里去的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sono sicura che il gatto conosce un posto dal quale posso entrare nella villa... e mi ci sta portando.

Steam (ST): Away from the light seeping from the hall, ...and towards the blackness lit only dimly by the lights in the garden, ...the cat and I continued to walk.
Umineko Project (UP): Away from the light seeping from the hall, ......and towards the blackness lit only dimly by the lights in the garden, ......the cat and I continued to walk.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Away from the light seeping from the hall, ......and towards the blackness lit only dimly by the lights in the garden, ......the cat and I continued to walk.
PC Japanese (JP): ホールから漏れていた明かりから遠ざかり、……庭園のわずかな外灯の明かりしかない真っ暗闇を、私と猫はしばらく歩く。
Russian (RU): От света, просачивающегося из зала, ......по направлению к тьме, освещённой лишь тусклыми огнями в саду...... мы с кошкой продолжали идти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Distante da luz que escapa do hall, ......na direção da escuridão mal‐iluminada pelas luzes do jardim, ......o gato e eu continuamos a andar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從大廳漏出的光芒漸漸遠去，……我和貓暫時走在，僅有庭園那微弱路燈光芒的黑暗之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从大厅漏出的光芒渐渐远去，……我和猫暂时走在，仅有庭园那微弱路灯光芒的黑暗之中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lontano dalle luci del salone... e verso l'oscurità illuminata parzialmente dalle luci nel giardino... io e il gatto continuammo a camminare.

Steam (ST): Then, ...I found it.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, .........I found it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, ......I found it.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、………それを見つけた。
Russian (RU): И тогда......... я нашла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, .........eu encontrei.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是，………我找到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是，………我找到了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Allora... la trovai.

Steam (ST): An open...window.
Umineko Project (UP): An open...window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An open...window.
PC Japanese (JP): 開いている、窓だ。
Russian (RU): Открытое... окно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma janela...aberta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 開著的，窗戶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 开着的，窗户。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Una finestra... aperta.

Steam (ST): The cat stood below it and looked between me and the window, as though telling me to go inside.
Umineko Project (UP): The cat stood below it and looked between me and the window, as though telling me to go inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The cat stood below it and looked between me and the window, as though telling me to go inside.
PC Japanese (JP): 猫はその下で、窓と私の顔を交互に見て、そこから入れと促しているように見えた。
Russian (RU): Кошка встала под ним и посмотрела сначала на меня, а потом на окно, как будто говоря мне войти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O gato parou diante dela e ficou olhando entre mim e a janela, como se estivesse me dizendo para entrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貓站在窗下，輪流看著窗戶和我的臉，大概是在催促我從這裡進去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 猫站在窗下，轮流看着窗户和我的脸，大概是在催促我从这里进去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il gatto stava sotto di essa e guardava tra me e la finestra, come per dirmi di entrare.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Thanks, kitty. I'd like to give you some milk to thank you. Won't you come with me?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Thanks, kitty‐cat. I want to give you some milk to thank you. Won't you come with me?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Thanks, kitty-cat. I want to give you some milk to thank you. Won't you come with me?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとう、猫さんっ。お礼にあなたにミルクがあげたいの。一緒にいらっしゃい？」
Russian (RU): "Спасибо, котёнок. Я хочу дать тебе молока в благодарность. Пойдёшь со мной?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigada, gatinho. Queria agradecê‐lo com um pouco de leite. Não quer vir comigo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝你，貓咪。作為答謝我喂你些牛奶吧。一起進來好嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢你，猫咪。作为答谢我喂你些牛奶吧。一起进来好吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Grazie, micino. Voglio darti del latte per ringraziarti. Vieni con me?"

Steam (ST): When I walked closer to pick the cat up, it slipped away from my hands and flew into the bushes in a nearby flower bed.
Umineko Project (UP): When I walked closer to pick the cat up, it slipped away from my hands and flew into the bushes in a nearby flower bed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 抱き上げようと近付くと、猫は私の手をするりと逃れ、花壇の茂みの中へ飛び込んでいく。
Russian (RU): Когда я подошла ближе, чтобы взять кошку, она выскользнула из моих рук и нырнула в соседнюю клумбу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando me aproximei para pegar o gato, ele escapuliu das minhas mãos e saltou na direção dos arbustos próximos do canteiro de flores.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我接近貓想要抱它起來，貓立刻從我的手中逃走，跳入茂密的花壇中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我接近猫想要抱它起来，猫立刻从我的手中逃走，跳入茂密的花坛中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando mi avvicinai per prendere il gatto, quello mi sfuggì dalle mani e si infilo nei cespugli di un'aiuola nelle vicinanze.

Steam (ST): Then, as though it really had melted away into the darkness inside the bush, all traces of it vanished.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, as though it really had melted away into the darkness inside the bush, all traces of it vanished.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, as though it really had melted away into the darkness inside the bush, all traces of it vanished.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、まるで茂みの中の闇に解けてしまったかのように、その気配はなくなった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、まるで茂みの中の闇にとけてしまったかのように、その気配はなくなった。
Russian (RU): Она исчезла, словно и в самом деле канула во тьму внутри куста.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, como se realmente tivesse derretido na escuridão dentro dos arbustos, todos os traços de sua existência desapareceram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之後，就像是溶解在植物叢的黑暗裡，失去了聲息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之后，就像是溶解在植物丛的黑暗里，失去了声息。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, come se davvero si fosse fuso con l'oscurità nel cespuglio, tutte le sue tracce svanirono.

Steam (ST): No matter how much I strained my ears, I couldn't hear the sound of that bell...
Umineko Project (UP): No matter how much I strained my ears, I couldn't hear the sound of that bell......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how much I strained my ears, I couldn't hear the sound of that bell......
PC Japanese (JP): いくら耳を澄ませてももう、あの鈴の音が聞こえることはなかった……。
Russian (RU): Сколько бы ни напрягала слух, я не слышала звон колокольчика......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa o quanto eu prestasse atenção, eu não consegui mais ouvir o som do seu sininho......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無論再怎麼仔細聽，也沒能聽到那鈴鐺的聲音……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无论再怎么仔细听，也没能听到那铃铛的声音……。

Steam (ST): Suddenly, the wind changed directions, and the rain started to hit me fiercely. I can't stay in a place like this forever.
Umineko Project (UP): Suddenly, the wind changed directions, and the rain started to hit me fiercely.{n}I can't stay in a place like this forever.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Suddenly, the wind changed directions, and the rain started to hit me fiercely. I can't stay in a place like this forever.
PC Japanese (JP): 突然、風向きが変わり、私に激しい雨が当たるようになる。いつまでもこんなところにいるわけにはいかなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 突然、風向きが変わり、私に激しい雨が当たるようになる。{n}いつまでもこんなところにいるわけにはいかなかった。
Russian (RU): Ветер вдруг изменил направление, и меня начал яростно хлестать дождь.{n}Я не могу вечно стоять здесь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De repente, a direção do vento mudou e a chuva começou a me atingir com força. Não posso ficar em um lugar desses para sempre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 突然，風向一轉，大雨淋到我身上。{n}不能總是待在這裡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 突然，风向一转，大雨淋到我身上。{n}不能总是待在这里了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Improvvisamente, il vento cambiò direzione, e la pioggia iniziò a colpirmi con violenza. Non posso stare qui così per sempre.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...I'll go inside. ...What room is this, I wonder...?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I'll go inside. ......What room is this, I wonder..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I'll go inside. ......What room is this, I wonder..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………入ろう。……どこの部屋だろ。」
Russian (RU): "......Пойду туда. ......Интересно, что там за комната..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Vou entrar. ......Que quarto será este...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………進去吧。……是哪個房間啊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………进去吧。……是哪个房间啊？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Entrerò. ... Chissà che stanza è questa..."

Steam (ST): I climbed up onto the windowsill and entered the room. Then, the window silently shut and locked itself.
Umineko Project (UP): I climbed up onto the windowsill and entered the room. Then, the window silently shut and locked itself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 窓枠をよじ登り、部屋の中に入り込む。すると、音もなく窓は閉まり、ひとりでに鍵まで閉まった。
Russian (RU): Я забралась на подоконник и вошла в комнату. Окно тихо закрылось и заперлось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu escalei o peitoril da janela e entrei no quarto. Logo depois, a janela se fechou silenciosamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我爬上窗沿，遛進房間中。緊接著，窗戶無聲地關上，連鎖都上好了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我爬上窗沿，遛进房间中。紧接着，窗户无声地关上，连锁都上好了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi arrampicai sul cornicione ed entrai nella stanza. Dopo, la finestra silenziosamente si chiuse da sola.

Steam (ST): ...Good. That saves me the trouble of doing it myself.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Good. That saves me the trouble of doing it myself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……締める手間が省けてよかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……閉める手間が省けてよかった。
Russian (RU): ......Отлично. Не придётся закрывать самой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ótimo. Assim não preciso ficar fechando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……省得去關了，真好。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……省得去关了，真好。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Buono. Mi ha risparmiato il problema di farlo da me.

Steam (ST): The room was completely dark. However, as my eyes got used to the darkness, I was able to make out a few things.
Umineko Project (UP): The room was completely dark. However, as my eyes got used to the darkness, I was able to make out a few things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The room was completely dark. However, as my eyes got used to the darkness, I was able to make out a few things.
PC Japanese (JP): その部屋は真っ暗な部屋だった。でも、目が闇に慣れていたお陰で、何となく様子がわかる。
Russian (RU): В комнате было совершенно темно. Но, как только мои глаза привыкли к темноте, я смогла кое‐что выяснить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quarto estava completamente escuro. Mas, conforme meus olhos foram se acostumando a escuridão, eu fui capaz de ver algumas coisas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個屋子黑漆漆的。但是，由於眼睛已經習慣了黑暗，大致能判明房間的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个屋子黑漆漆的。但是，由于眼睛已经习惯了黑暗，大致能判明房间的样子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La stanza era completamente buia. Tuttavia, non appena i miei occhi si adattarono all'oscurità, riuscii a distinguere un paio di cose.

Steam (ST): It was a large room. There was a long table...and many chairs. ...It was...the dining hall.
Umineko Project (UP): It was a large room. There was a long table, and many chairs.{n}......It was...the dining hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a large room. There was a long table, and many chairs.......It was...the dining hall.
PC Japanese (JP): 広い部屋。そして長く大きな机とたくさんの椅子。……ここは、食堂だったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 広い部屋。そして長く大きな机とたくさんの椅子。{n}……ここは、食堂だったのだ。
Russian (RU): Комната большая. Есть длинный стол и много стульев.{n}......Столовая.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um quarto grande. Havia uma longa mesa e várias cadeiras.{n}......Era...a sala de jantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 很大的房間。還有又長又大的桌子和很多椅子。{n}……這裡是，餐廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 很大的房间。还有又长又大的桌子和很多椅子。{n}……这里是，餐厅。

Steam (ST): Perhaps because I realized this and relaxed, it quickly became hard for me to make out details.
Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps because I realized this and was relieved, I was suddenly unable to see again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Perhaps because I realized this and was relieved, I was suddenly unable to see again.
PC Japanese (JP): それがわかり、安心したせいか、目がみるみる見えなくなっていく。
Russian (RU): Возможно, из‐за того, что я поняла это и успокоилась, я вдруг не смогла увидеть снова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez por ter ficado aliviada após perceber isso, de repente eu fiquei incapaz de ver novamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 知道了這點，大概是因為安心了下來，眼睛漸漸看不清楚了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 知道了这点，大概是因为安心了下来，眼睛渐渐看不清楚了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse perché lo capii e fui sollevata, improvvisamente non fui di nuovo in grado di vedere.

Steam (ST): I searched blindly along the wall for the light switch.
Umineko Project (UP): I searched blindly along the wall for the light switch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I searched blindly along the wall for the light switch.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu procurei cegamente pela parede por um interruptor.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我为了寻找灯的开关，找着墙壁向前行进。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, finally, I felt a familiar shape.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Wouldn't it be annoying if I pushed this, and the light didn't come on?

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但如果按下它，灯也欺负人，不亮起来，那该怎么办？

Umineko Project (UP): In fact, ......it was nearly the opposite, and an annoyingly bright light filled the dining hall and made my eyes hurt.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In fact, ......it was nearly the opposite, and an annoyingly bright light filled the dining hall and made my eyes hurt.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, ......foi completamente oposto, e uma luz irritante iluminou a sala de jantar, fazendo meus olhos doerem.

Steam (ST): The hall was alive with a mingling of Humans and the magical Illusions who lived on this island.

Umineko Project (UP): At first, everyone stayed with their own groups, too nervous to mingle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, everyone stayed with their own groups, too nervous to mingle.

Umineko Project (UP): However, as time passed, people started to move around, and both halves began to chat happily together.

Umineko Project (UP): "Leadership's important. You've gotta lead by example if you want anyone to follow you!"

Steam (ST): "Okay, okay, now it's my turn to think of a question! Umm, okay, so you have a third of a cake, a quarter of a cake, and a fifth of a cake all on a plate! It takes 30 minutes to eat one whole cake, so how much is left on the plate when you've finished eating?!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Okay, okay, now it's my turn to think of a question! Umm, okay, so you have a third of a whole cake, a quarter of a cake, and a fifth of a cake all on a plate! It takes 30 minutes to eat one whole cake, so how much is left on the plate when you've finished eating?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあじゃあ、次は私が問題を出す番ねー！えっとねえっとね、１ホールの３分の１のケーキと４分の１のケーキと５分の１のケーキがお皿に載ってるの！　１ホールを食べるのには３０分かかるとして、食べ終わった時、お皿にケーキはいくつあるでしょう？！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「じゃあじゃあ、次は私が問題を出す番ねー！　えっとねえっとね、１ホールの３分の１のケーキと４分の１のケーキと５分の１のケーキがお皿に載ってるの！　１ホールを食べるのには３０分かかるとして、食べ終わった時、お皿にケーキはいくつあるでしょう？！」
Russian (RU): "Так‐так, моя очередь придумывать вопрос! Э‐э, итак, на тарелке есть треть целого торта, четверть торта и пятая часть торта! На съедание целого торта уходит 30 минут, так сколько останется на тарелке, когда закончишь есть?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Beleza! Agora é a minha vez de perguntar! Hmm, certo, então você tem um terço de um bolo inteiro, um quarto de um bolo e um quinto de um bolo, tudo no mesmo prato! Leva trinta minutos para comer um bolo inteiro, então quanto sobra no prato quando você termina de comer?!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那那，下一个轮到我来出题了吧——！那个啊那个啊，盘子里放着一整个蛋糕中 3 分之 1 的蛋糕和 4 分之 1 的蛋糕和 5 分之 1 的蛋糕各一块！吃掉一整个蛋糕需要 30 分钟，那么吃完的时候，盘子里的蛋糕还剩多少？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ok, ok, ora è il mio turno di pensare a una domanda! Umm, ok, allora ci sono un terzo di torta, un quarto di torta e un quinto di torta tutti su un piatto! {n}Ci vogliono 30 minuti per mangiare una torta intera, quindi quanta ne rimane sul piatto quando avrai finito di mangiare?!"

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "Heheheheh, ...ahahahahahahahah... What were you expecting, a happy mystery chat between Humans and witches?! Come on, don't make me laugh! Let's see if your cheery mysteries are any match for the one I've prepared! Let's see what you've got!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Heheheheh....... Ahahahahahahahah...... A {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} and a witch discussing a mystery side by side?! It's ridiculous! Ludicrous! Let's see if your cheery take on mysteries can handle mine! I challenge you to solve my mystery!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Heheheheh......., ahahahahahahahah...... You mean that happy mystery chat between humans and witches?! Come on, don't make me laugh! Let's see if your cheery take on mysteries can handle mine! Let's see what you can manage!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふっふふふ………、あっはっははははははは……。ニンゲンと魔女が仲良く肩を並べてミステリー談義なんて！　馬鹿馬鹿しいわ、笑えるわッ。あんたたちの仲良しミステリーが、私の用意したミステリーに通用するかどうか、試してあげるッ！　受けてみなさい、私のミステリー！！」
Russian (RU): "Хе‐хе‐хе‐хех... аха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха...... Имеете в виду счастливую беседу {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей и ведьм о детективах?! Не смешите меня! Проверим, сможете ли вы со своим бодрым взглядом на детективы выдержать мой детектив! Посмотрим, что у вас выйдет!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Heheheheh....... Ahahahahahahahah...... Um {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} e uma bruxa, lado a lado, discutindo sobre um mistério?! Isso é ridículo! Dá vontade de rir! Vamos ver se o mistério amigável de vocês é capaz de lidar com o meu! Eu os desafio a resolver o meu mistério!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵呵呵呵………，啊哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈……。人類和魔女相親相愛並肩相談推理劇什麼的！簡直愚蠢，可笑。我就試試你們那相親相愛的推理劇，能不能在我準備的推理劇裡通用！好好接招吧，我的推理劇！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵呵呵呵………，啊哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈……。人类和魔女相亲相爱并肩相谈推理剧什么的！简直愚蠢，可笑。我就试试你们那相亲相爱的推理剧，能不能在我准备的推理剧里通用！好好接招吧，我的推理剧！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Heheheheh... ahahahahahahahah. {n}Intendete quel discorsetto sul giallo felice tra streghe e umani?! Avanti, non fatemi ridere! Vediamo se i vostri romanzetti reggono il confronto con la mia storia! Vediamo cosa sapete fare!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange

Steam (ST): At some point, Ange had fainted and fallen to the floor.
Umineko Project (UP): At some point, Ange had fainted and fallen to the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿はいつの間にか、床に倒れて、意識を失っていたのだ。
Russian (RU): В какой‐то момент Энджи потеряла сознание и упала на пол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em determinado momento, Ange desmaiou e caiu no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽不知何時起，倒在地板上，失去了意識。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿不知何时起，倒在地板上，失去了意识。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ad un certo punto, Ange era svenuta cadendo a terra.

Steam (ST): Now, her consciousness was slowly returning, ...forcing her to remember what had happened in this room.
Umineko Project (UP): Now, her consciousness was slowly returning, ......forcing her to remember what had happened in this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Now, her consciousness was slowly returning, ......forcing her to remember what had happened in this room.
PC Japanese (JP): 意識がゆっくりと戻り、……この部屋に何があったか、記憶を取り戻させる。
Russian (RU): Сознание медленно возвращалось...... вынуждая её вспомнить о произошедшем в этой комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, sua consciência retornava lentamente, ......forçando‐a a lembrar o que havia acontecido ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 意識慢慢歸來，……這屋內所發生的事，也在記憶中被喚醒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 意识慢慢归来，……这屋内所发生的事，也在记忆中被唤醒。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ora, stava lentamente riprendendo i sensi... sforzandosi di ricordare cosa fosse avvenuto in questa stanza.

Steam (ST): So, she reflexively averted her gaze even before the memory overtook her.
Umineko Project (UP): So, she reflexively averted her gaze even before the memory overtook her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, she reflexively averted her gaze even before the memory overtook her.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、それが戻る前に反射的に目を背けた。
Russian (RU): Поэтому она рефлекторно отвела взгляд ещё до того, как память нагнала её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ela reflexivamente desviou seu olhar antes que fosse tomada por suas memórias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，在記憶回來之前反射性地將目光瞥開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，在记忆回来之前反射性地将目光瞥开。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, istintivamente spostò lo sguardo ancor prima che la memoria glielo ricordasse.

Steam (ST): Six bodies lay in the bloodstained dining hall.
Umineko Project (UP): Six bodies lay in the blood‐stained dining hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Six bodies lay in the blood-stained dining hall.

Russian (RU): В окровавленной столовой лежало шесть тел.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seis corpos caídos na sala de jantar manchada de sangue.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 满地鲜血的餐厅，倒着 6 个人的遗骸。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sei corpi giacevano nella sala da pranzo ricoperta di sangue.

Steam (ST): Strangely enough, as her consciousness returned bit by bit, the terrifying scene before her seemed somehow less intense.
Umineko Project (UP): Strangely enough, as her consciousness returned bit by bit, the terrifying scene before her seemed somehow less intense.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Strangely enough, as her consciousness returned bit by bit, the terrifying scene before her seemed somehow less intense.

Russian (RU): Как ни странно, когда её сознание постепенно вернулось, страшная сцена перед ней стала выглядеть менее напряжённой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por mais estranho que pudesse parecer, conforme sua consciência retornava aos poucos, a terrível cena diante dela ia parecendo menos intensa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 很不可思議地，當意識慢慢歸來後，眼前的那恐怖的光景，讓人感覺稍微有那麼些緩和了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 很不可思议地，当意识慢慢归来后，眼前的那恐怖的光景，让人感觉稍微有那么些缓和了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Stranamente, man mano che riprendeva i sensi, quella scena orribile sembrava meno intensa in qualche modo.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, this time, Ange was able to look at the six corpses well enough to make out who they were.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seis pessoas.
