Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sei persone.

Steam (ST): A full six people...had their lives taken from them...and are lying in this room...
Umineko Project (UP): A full six people......had their lives taken from them...and are lying in this room......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A full six people......had their lives taken from them, and are lying in this room......
PC Japanese (JP): この部屋には６人もの人間が、……命を奪われ、横たわっているのだ……。
Russian (RU): Целых шесть человек...... лежали мёртвыми в этой комнате......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um total de seis pessoas......tiveram suas vidas tomadas...e estavam caídas nesta sala......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個房間裡有 6 個人，……被奪去了性命，橫屍於此……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个房间里有 6 个人，……被夺去了性命，横尸于此……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A ben sei persone... è stata strappata la vita, e ora giacciono in questa stanza...

Steam (ST): Maybe I cried myself out before I fell unconscious. ...The scene before me was still terribly painful, ...but I was somehow able to look at it without losing my head.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe I had cried myself out before I fell unconscious. ......The scene before me was still terribly painful, ......but I was somehow able to look at it without losing my head.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe I cried myself out before I fell unconscious. ......The scene before me was still terribly painful, ......but I was somehow able to look at it without losing my head.
PC Japanese (JP): 意識を失う前に、涙を流し尽くしたからだろうか。……それらが辛い光景であることに変わりはなかったが、……どこか乾いた気持ちで見られるようになっていた。
Russian (RU): Может, я выплакалась до того, как упала без сознания. ......Сцена передо мной по‐прежнему была ужасно мучительной...... но я кое‐как смогла взглянуть на неё, не теряя головы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez eu tenha chorado tanto que acabei perdendo a consciência. ......A cena diante de mim ainda era terrivelmente dolorosa, ......mas eu meio que consegui olhar diretamente para eles sem enlouquecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大概是在失去意識之前，眼淚就流光了吧。……雖然這依舊是令人痛心的光景，……但現在感覺似乎變得冷淡一些了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大概是在失去意识之前，眼泪就流光了吧。……虽然这依旧是令人痛心的光景，……但现在感觉似乎变得冷淡一些了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse ho pianto prima di svenire. ... La scena che avevo davanti era ancora terribilmente dolorosa... ma in qualche modo ero in grado di vederla senza perdere la testa.

Steam (ST): I'd already felt all the sadness I could at my parents' deaths.
Umineko Project (UP): So, I'd already felt all the sadness I could at my parents' deaths.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I'd already felt all the sadness I could at my parents' deaths.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、両親が死んでしまったことへの悲しみは、もう出尽くしてる。
Russian (RU): Поэтому я уже испытала всю возможную печаль от смерти своих родителей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu já tinha sentido a tristeza pela morte dos meus pais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，雙親已死的悲傷，已經抒發盡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，双亲已死的悲伤，已经抒发尽了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, avevo già provato tutta la tristezza possibile per le morti dei miei genitori.

Steam (ST): The next emotion that rose up inside me...was a desire to check and see that everyone else was okay.
Umineko Project (UP): The next emotion that rose up inside me......was a desire to check and see that everyone else was okay.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The next emotion that rose up inside me......was a desire to check and see that everyone else was okay.
PC Japanese (JP): 次に湧き上がった感情は、……それ以外の人たちは無事だろうか、確かめたいという気持ちだった。
Russian (RU): Следующей моей эмоцией...... было желание проверить, всё ли хорошо с остальными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A emoção que desencadeou em mim logo em seguida......foi um desejo de ver se todos estavam bem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之後涌上的感情是，……想要確認其他人都還沒事吧的心情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之后涌上的感情是，……想要确认其他人都还没事吧的心情。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'emozione che subito dopo crebbe dentro di me... era il desiderio di controllare che tutti gli altri stessero bene.

Steam (ST): In that instant, ...I heard a scraping sound.
Umineko Project (UP): In that instant, ......Ange heard a scraping sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that instant, ......she heard a scraping sound.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、カリリと、……硬いものを引っ掻くような音が聞こえた。
Russian (RU): В этот момент...... она услышала скрежет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse instante, ......Ange ouviu o som de algo raspando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這時，聽到了嘎啦啦的，……有什麼硬的東西撓動的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这时，听到了嘎啦啦的，……有什么硬的东西挠动的声音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel momento... Ange sentì un rumore raschiante.

Steam (ST): Just as I was about to relax again, thinking I must have imagined it, I heard the same sound again.
Umineko Project (UP): Thinking she must have imagined it, she was about to relax when she heard the sound once more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just as she was about to relax again, thinking she must have imagined it, she heard the same sound again.
PC Japanese (JP): 気のせいかと息を潜めると、もう一度同じ音が聞こえた。
Russian (RU): Как только она снова собралась расслабиться, подумав, что ей показалось, тот же звук раздался ещё раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pensando que tinha imaginado algo, ela estava prestes a relaxar quando ouviu um outro som.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知是不是幻聽而屏住了呼吸，馬上又再次聽到了相同的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知是不是幻听而屏住了呼吸，马上又再次听到了相同的声音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Proprio quando stava per rilassarsi di nuovo, pensando che doveva esserselo immaginato, lo sentì di nuovo.

Steam (ST): It was probably coming from the door. Someone was clawing at the door from the outside.
Umineko Project (UP): It was probably coming from the door.{n}Someone was clawing at the door from the outside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was probably coming from the door. Someone was clawing at the door from the outside.
PC Japanese (JP): それは多分、扉からだ。扉を外側から、誰かが引っ掻いているのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それは多分、扉からだ。{n}扉を外側から、誰かが引っ掻いているのだ。
Russian (RU): Он шёл от двери.{n}Кто‐то царапал дверь с другой стороны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente vinha da porta.{n}Alguém estava arranhando a porta pelo lado de fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這大概是，從門那裡。{n}從門外，有人在撓著什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这大概是，从门那里。{n}从门外，有人在挠着什么。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente veniva dalla porta. Qualcuno stava graffiando la porta dall'esterno.

Steam (ST): Of course, I had no way of knowing who it was.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, she had no way of knowing who it was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, she had no way of knowing who it was.
PC Japanese (JP): 誰が引っ掻いているのかは、もちろんわからない。
Russian (RU): Естественно, она не могла знать, кто.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Obviamente, ela não tinha como saber quem era.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是誰在撓，這當然不知道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是谁在挠，这当然不知道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, non aveva modo di sapere chi fosse.

Steam (ST): However, for some reason, I was sure that it was that black cat scratching at the door.
Umineko Project (UP): However, for some reason, she was sure that it was that black cat scratching at the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, for some reason, Ange was sure that it was that black cat scratching at the door.
PC Japanese (JP): でも縁寿にはどういうわけか、きっとあの黒猫が引っ掻いているに違いないと、そう思った。
Russian (RU): Однако Энджи почему‐то была уверена, что в дверь скребётся та чёрная кошка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, por algum motivo, ela tinha certeza que era o gato preto que estava arranhando a porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是緣壽不知為何，覺得那一定是那只黑貓在撓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是缘寿不知为何，觉得那一定是那只黑猫在挠。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, per qualche motivo, Ange era sicura che fosse il gatto nero a graffiare la porta.

Steam (ST): ...The black cat was telling me to leave this room.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The black cat was telling her to leave this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……黒猫が、この部屋を出ようと言っている。
Russian (RU): ......Чёрная кошка говорит ей покинуть эту комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O gato preto estava dizendo para ela deixar a sala.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……黑貓在說，從這個房間出來吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……黑猫在说，从这个房间出来吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il gatto nero le stava dicendo di lasciare questa stanza.

Steam (ST): I understood and put my hand on the doorknob.
Umineko Project (UP): Ange understood and put her hand on the doorknob.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange understood and put her hand on the doorknob.
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿はそう理解し、扉のノブに手を掛けた。
Russian (RU): Энджи поняла и положила руку на дверную ручку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange entendeu isso e colocou sua mão na maçaneta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽這樣理解著，把手放在門把手上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿这样理解着，把手放在门把手上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ange lo capì e mise la sua mano sulla maniglia.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JP]

Steam (ST): I immediately noticed something odd. The door was locked.
Umineko Project (UP): I immediately noticed something odd. The door was locked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): すぐに違和感。それは施錠の手応えだった。
Russian (RU): Я сразу же заметила нечто странное. Дверь была заперта.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Imediatamente eu percebi algo estranho. A porta estava fechada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 立刻感到了違和感。這是上鎖的手感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 立刻感到了违和感。这是上锁的手感。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi accorsi subito di una cosa strana. La porta era chiusa.

Steam (ST): The same bad feeling I'd felt after being locked in the parlor crawled up my spine.
Umineko Project (UP): The same bad feeling I'd felt after being locked in the parlor crawled up my spine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The same bad feeling I'd felt after being locked in the parlor crawled up my spine.
PC Japanese (JP): 客間に閉じ込められた、あの嫌な気持ちが、背中をぞわりと這い上がる。
Russian (RU): По спине поползло то же плохое предчувствие, что и когда меня заперли в гостиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O mesmo mal pressentimento que senti após ser trancada na sala de visitas subiu pela minha espinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被關在客廳的那種討厭的感覺，讓人後背發涼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被关在客厅的那种讨厌的感觉，让人后背发凉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La stessa cattiva sensazione che avevo provato dopo essere stata chiusa nel salotto mi risalì lungo la schiena.

Steam (ST): ...However, unlike the time in the parlor, this door unlocked itself easily when I turned the knob.
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, unlike the time in the parlor, this door unlocked itself easily when I turned the knob.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、客間の時と違い、施錠のつまみは、ひねると簡単に開けることが出来た。
Russian (RU): ......Однако, в отличие от случая в гостиной, эта дверь запросто отперлась, когда я повернула ручку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas, diferente da sala de visitas, a porta se destrancou facilmente depois que eu virei a tranca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，和客廳那時不一樣，把上鎖的旋鈕簡單一擰，門就可以打開了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，和客厅那时不一样，把上锁的旋钮简单一拧，门就可以打开了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, diversamente da quella volta, questa porta si aprì facilmente girando la manopola.

Steam (ST): I unlocked it...and slowly opened the door...
Umineko Project (UP): I unlocked it...and slowly opened the door......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I unlocked it...and slowly opened the door...
PC Japanese (JP): 鍵を開け、ゆっくりと扉を開く……。
Russian (RU): Я отперла её... и медленно открыла дверь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu a destranquei...e lentamente abri a porta......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 打開鎖，慢慢推開門……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 打开锁，慢慢推开门……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La sbloccai... e lentamente aprii la porta...

Steam (ST): Beyond the door, ...I could see the dimly-lit hallway...and a cat dashing down it away from me.
Umineko Project (UP): Beyond the door, .........I could see the dimly‐lit hallway, and a cat dashing down it away from me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beyond the door, ......I could see the dimly-lit hallway, and a cat dashing down it away from me.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉が開くと、………薄暗い廊下が見え、その向こうに、黒猫が駆けて行くのが見えた。
Russian (RU): За дверью...... я увидела тускло освещённый коридор и кошку, несущуюся прочь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além da porta, .........eu pude ver o corredor mal‐iluminado e o gato correndo para longe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 門一開，………就能看到昏暗的走廊對面，黑貓跑走的身影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 门一开，………就能看到昏暗的走廊对面，黑猫跑走的身影。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Al di là della porta... potevo vedere un corridoio lievemente illuminato, e un gatto che correva via da me.

Steam (ST): Then, it stopped, its emerald eyes glittering in the darkness, ...as though it was waiting for me to follow.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, it stopped, its emerald eyes glittering in the darkness, ......as though it was waiting for me to follow.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, it stopped, its emerald eyes glittering in the darkness, ......as though it was waiting for me to follow.
PC Japanese (JP): そして立ち止まり、エメラルドの瞳を暗闇に輝かせ、……私が来るのを待っているようだった。
Russian (RU): Затем она остановилась, сверкая в темноте изумрудными глазами...... словно ожидая, пока я последую за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ele parou, com seus olhos esmeraldas brilhando na escuridão, ......como se estivesse dizendo para eu segui‐lo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後它停下，祖母綠色的眼瞳在黑暗中閃耀，……似乎是在等著我過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后它停下，祖母绿色的眼瞳在黑暗中闪耀，……似乎是在等着我过去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi si fermò, gli occhi di smeraldo che scintillavano nell'oscurità... come se stesse aspettando che lo seguissi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Russian (RU): [=OG]
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JPC]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JPC]

Steam (ST): The hallway was dark...and wrapped in an eerie silence.
Umineko Project (UP): The hallway was dark......and dominated by an eerie silence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The hallway was dark......and wrapped in an eerie silence.
PC Japanese (JP): 廊下は薄暗く、……不気味な静寂に支配されていた。
Russian (RU): Коридор был мрачен...... и окутан жуткой тишиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O corredor estava escuro......e dominado por um ominoso silêncio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走廊上很昏暗，……被可怕的靜寂所支配。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走廊上很昏暗，……被可怕的静寂所支配。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il corridoio era buio... e avvolto da uno spaventoso silenzio.

Steam (ST): When the black cat saw that I was coming, it walked forward as if guiding me.
Umineko Project (UP): When the black cat saw that I was coming, it walked forward as if guiding me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the black cat saw that I was coming, it walked forward as if guiding me.
PC Japanese (JP): 黒猫は、私が来たことを見届けると、先導するように歩き出す。
Russian (RU): Увидев, что я иду, чёрная кошка пошла дальше, будто ведя меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o gato preto viu que eu estava indo atrás, ele seguiu em frente, como se estivesse me guiando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 黑貓見我跟了過去，繼續向前走為我領路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 黑猫见我跟了过去，继续向前走为我领路。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando il gatto nero vide che stavo arrivando, riprese a camminare come se mi stesse guidando.

Steam (ST): I could hear nothing except the creaking of the floor, the bell of the cat, ...and the sound of the storm outside.
Umineko Project (UP): I could hear nothing except the creaking of the floor, the jingling of the cat's bell, ......and the howling of the storm outside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I could hear nothing except the creaking of the floor, the bell of the cat, ......and the sound of the storm outside.
PC Japanese (JP): 床を踏みしめると聞こえる軋むような音と、猫の鈴の音、……そして風雨の音以外に聞こえるものは、何もなかった。
Russian (RU): Я слышала только скрип пола, кошачий колокольчик...... и бурю снаружи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não consegui ouvir nada além do ranger do piso, o badalar do sininho do gato ......e o rugido da tempestade lá fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 除了踩地板時能聽到的嘎吱聲和，貓的鈴鐺的聲音，……還有風雨聲之外，什麼都聽不到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 除了踩地板时能听到的嘎吱声和，猫的铃铛的声音，……还有风雨声之外，什么都听不到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non potevo sentire nulla eccetto gli scricchiolii del pavimento, il campanellino del gatto... e il suono della tempesta all'esterno.

Steam (ST): ...The party is being held in the hall.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The party is being held in the hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……パーティーはホールでやっているのだ。
Russian (RU): ......В зале проводится вечеринка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A festa está acontecendo no hall.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大廳還在開派對呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大厅还在开派对呢。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La festa si tiene nel salone.

Steam (ST): I should be able to hear at least a little of the noise from this hallway...
Umineko Project (UP): I should be able to hear at least a little of the noise from this hallway......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I should be able to hear at least a little of the noise from this hallway......
PC Japanese (JP): 廊下に出れば、その賑やかな気配が、少しは聞こえてもいいはず……。
Russian (RU): Из этого коридора должно быть слышно хоть немного шума......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu deveria ser capaz de ao menos ouvir um pouco da agitação de lá......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走到走廊上，那熱鬧的感覺，應該能稍微聽到一點點的……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走到走廊上，那热闹的感觉，应该能稍微听到一点点的……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dovrei poter sentire almeno un po' di rumore da questo corridoio...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...Maybe it got really late...when I was unconscious in the dining hall..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Maybe it got really late......while I was passed out in the dining hall..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Maybe it got really late......while I was unconscious in the dining hall..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………私が食堂で意識を失ってる間に、……深夜になっちゃったのかな…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………私が食堂で意識を失ってる間に、……深夜になっちゃったのかな…」
Russian (RU): "......Может, стало очень поздно...... пока я была без сознания в столовой..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Talvez tenha passado muito tempo......enquanto eu estava desmaiada na sala de jantar..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我在餐廳失去意識的時候，……是不是到了深夜啊…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我在餐厅失去意识的时候，……是不是到了深夜啊…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Forse si è fatto davvero tardi... mentre ero svenuta nella sala da pranzo..."

Steam (ST): It was a reasonable conclusion. Then, we finally reached the main hall.
Umineko Project (UP): It was a reasonable conclusion. Then, we finally reached the main hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): それは妥当な推理だった。そして、とうとうホールに至る。
Russian (RU): Разумный вывод. Мы наконец дошли до главного зала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa era uma conclusão razoável. E então, nós finalmente chegamos no hall.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是恰當的推理。之後，終於到了客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是恰当的推理。之后，终于到了客厅。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era una possibilità. Allora, raggiungemmo finalmente la sala principale.

Steam (ST): ...The hall was frigid, and no trace of that party remained.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The hall was frigid, and no trace of that party atmosphere remained.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The hall was frigid, and no trace of that party remained.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ホールは寒々としていて、あの賑やかで楽しかったパーティーの気配は、微塵もない。
Russian (RU): ......Там было холодно, и от вечеринки не осталось и следа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele estava gelado e sem vestígios remanescentes da atmosfera da festa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大廳冷冷清清的，完全感受不到那個熱鬧有趣的派對的氣氛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大厅冷冷清清的，完全感受不到那个热闹有趣的派对的气氛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La sala era fredda, e non vi erano tracce rimanenti della festa.

Steam (ST): Could all of that fun have been...just an illusion...?
Umineko Project (UP): Could all of that fun have been......just an illusion......?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Could all of that fun have been......just an illusion......?
PC Japanese (JP): あの楽しかった時間は、……まさか、全て幻……？
Russian (RU): Неужели всё то веселье...... было лишь иллюзией?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Será que toda aquela diversão......foi apenas uma ilusão......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那愉快的時光，……難道，全是幻覺……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那愉快的时光，……难道，全是幻觉……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse tutto quel divertimento era stato... solo un'illusione...?

Steam (ST): The black cat's bell rang out.
Umineko Project (UP): The black cat's bell rang out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 黒猫は、コロンと鈴を鳴らす。
Russian (RU): Чёрная кошка позвенела колокольчиком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O sininho do gato fez barulho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 黑貓“鐺啷”地晃響鈴聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 黑猫“铛啷”地晃响铃声。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il campanellino del gatto nero risuonò.

Steam (ST): When I looked up, I saw that it had its feet on the stairway to the second floor, ...urging me to follow it.
Umineko Project (UP): When I looked up, I saw it had its feet on the stairway to the second floor, urging me to follow it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I looked up, I saw it had its feet on the stairway to the second floor...urging me to follow it.
PC Japanese (JP): 見ると、２階への大階段に足を掛け、ついてくるように促していた。
Russian (RU): Подняв голову, я увидела, что она стоит на лестнице на второй этаж, призывая меня пойти следом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando olhei, eu o vi com os pés prontos para subir a escadaria em direção ao segundo andar, incitando para que eu o seguisse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看起來，催促我快點跟上，把腳踏上通向 2 層的大樓梯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看起来，催促我快点跟上，把脚踏上通向 2 层的大楼梯。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando guardai in alto, vidi che teneva le zampe sulla scala per il primo piano... sollecitandomi a seguirlo.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...Are you going to the second floor...?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Are we going up to the second floor...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Are you going to the second floor...?"
Russian (RU): "......Ты собираешься на второй этаж?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Estamos indo para o segundo andar...?"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Vai al primo piano...?"

Steam (ST): The black cat seemed to nod, then silently went up the stairs.
Umineko Project (UP): The black cat seemed to nod, then silently ascended the stairs.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The black cat seemed to nod, then silently went up the stairs.
PC Japanese (JP): 黒猫は頷く仕草を見せてから、音もなく階段を上っていく。
Russian (RU): Чёрная кошка, казалось, кивнула, и молча пошла вверх по лестнице.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O gato preto pareceu ter concordado e silenciosamente subiu a escadaria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 黑貓對我點點頭，無聲地上了台階。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 黑猫对我点点头，无声地上了台阶。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembrava che il gatto nero stesse annuendo, poi silenziosamente salì per le scale.

Steam (ST): ...Guests were allowed to go wherever they wanted on the first floor, but the second floor was Krauss's family's house, and I remembered getting in trouble for trying to go up there.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Guests were allowed to go wherever they wanted on the first floor, but the second floor was Uncle Krauss's family's house, and I remembered getting in trouble for trying to go up there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Guests were allowed to go wherever they wanted on the first floor, but the second floor was Krauss's family's house, and I remembered getting in trouble for trying to go up there.
PC Japanese (JP): ……１階はお客さんが出入りしてもいいところだけど、２階は蔵臼伯父さんたちのお家だから、勝手に階段を上ってはいけないと怒られたことがあるのを思い出す。
Russian (RU): ......Гостям было разрешено ходить где угодно на первом этаже, но второй этаж был домом семьи дяди Краусса, и я помню, как попала в неприятности, попытавшись пойти туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Convidados podem ir para onde quiserem no primeiro andar, mas o segundo andar é a casa da família do tio Krauss, e eu me lembro de já ter tido problemas por tentar subir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……1 層可以隨意讓客人進出，但 2 層就是藏臼伯父他們的家了，我還記得曾經被大人訓斥不可以擅自上樓的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……1 层可以随意让客人进出，但 2 层就是藏臼伯父他们的家了，我还记得曾经被大人训斥不可以擅自上楼的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Gli ospiti possono andare dove voglio al piano terra, ma al primo piano c'è la casa della famiglia di Krauss, e ricordavo di essermi cacciata nei guai per aver provato ad andarci.

Steam (ST): However, at that moment, I couldn't think of any options...other than following that cat...
Umineko Project (UP): However, at that moment, I couldn't think of any options...other than following that cat......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, at that moment, I couldn't think of any options...other than following that cat......
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、今の縁寿には、猫の後を追うしか選択肢は思い付かなかった……。
Russian (RU): Но сейчас мне остаётся только... следовать за этой кошкой......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, no momento, eu não consegui pensar em nenhuma outra opção...além de seguir o gato preto......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，對現在的緣壽來說，也想不到除了追在貓的身後之外的選擇了……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，对现在的缘寿来说，也想不到除了追在猫的身后之外的选择了……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, in quel momento, non avevo altra scelta... che seguire quel gatto...

Steam (ST): I walked along the dark hallway with the black cat. Eventually, we reached one of the doors.
Umineko Project (UP): I walked along the dark hallway with the black cat.{n}Eventually, we reached one of the doors.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I walked along the dark hallway with the black cat. Eventually, we reached one of the doors.
PC Japanese (JP): 暗い廊下を、黒猫とともに歩く。やがて、１つの扉の前に辿り着く。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 暗い廊下を、黒猫とともに歩く。{n}やがて、１つの扉の前に辿り着く。
Russian (RU): Я шла с чёрной кошкой по тёмному коридору.{n}В конце концов мы дошли до одной из дверей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu caminhei pelo corredor escuro na companhia do gato.{n}Eventualmente, nós chegamos em uma das portas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在黑暗的走廊上，緣壽和黑貓一起前行。{n}終於，到了一扇門前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在黑暗的走廊上，缘寿和黑猫一起前行。{n}终于，到了一扇门前。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Camminavo lungo il corridoio buio insieme al gatto nero. Infine, raggiungemmo una delle porte.

Steam (ST): The black cat scratched at the door, then turned to look at me. ...It must have been telling me to open it.
Umineko Project (UP): The black cat scratched at the door, then turned to look at me.{n}......It must have been telling me to open it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The black cat scratched at the door, then turned to look at me.......It must have been telling me to open it.
PC Japanese (JP): 黒猫は、カリリと扉を引っ掻き、縁寿に振り返る。……開けろ、と促しているに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 黒猫は、カリリと扉を引っ掻き、縁寿に振り返る。{n}……開けろ、と促しているに違いない。
Russian (RU): Чёрная кошка поскреблась в дверь, а потом повернулась и взглянула на меня.{n}......Наверное, говорит мне открыть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O gato preto arranhou a porta e virou para mim.{n}......Ele deve estar querendo que eu abra.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 黑猫用爪子挠着门，回头看向缘寿。{n}……无疑是在催促着，快点开门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il gatto nero graffiò la porta, poi si girò verso di me. ... Stava cercando di dirmi di aprirla.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Okay... ...I'll open it for you..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Okay...... ......I'll open it for you......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Okay...... ......I'll open it for you..."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certo...... ......Vou abrir para você......"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ok... la aprirò per te..."

Steam (ST): I put my hand on the doorknob...and felt the resistance of a lock again.
Umineko Project (UP): I put my hand on the doorknob......and felt the resistance of a lock again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿はノブに手を掛けるが、……またしても施錠の手応えを感じる。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽握住門的把手，……就又感到了上鎖的手感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿握住门的把手，……就又感到了上锁的手感。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Misi la mano sulla maniglia... e sentii di nuovo la resistenza della serratura.

Steam (ST): This door is locked. ...I turned around to tell the cat this, ...but...inexplicably... a single key lay right in front of the cat.
Umineko Project (UP): This door is locked. ......I turned around to tell the cat this, ......but...inexplicably...a single key lay right in front of the cat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This door is locked. ......I turned around to tell the cat this, ...but...inexplicably... a single key lay right in front of the cat.
PC Japanese (JP): 鍵が掛かっているよ。……黒猫にそう言おうとして振り返ると、……黒猫の前には、どこから現れたのか、一本の鍵が置かれていた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esta porta está fechada. ......Eu me virei para dizer isso ao gato, ......mas...inexplicavelmente...uma única chave estava diante do gato.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 门是上了锁的哟。……她回头想对黑猫这么说时，……在黑猫的面前，出现了，一把不知从哪里来的钥匙。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa porta è chiusa. ... Mi girai per dirlo al gatto... ma... inspiegabilmente... c'era una chiave di fronte al gatto.

Steam (ST): Ange picked it up and stuck it in the keyhole.
Umineko Project (UP): Ange picked it up and stuck it in the keyhole.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ange picked it up and stuck it in the keyhole.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange a pegou e colocou no buraco da fechadura.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 把它拾起，插入钥匙孔。

Steam (ST): ...As she did, she finally noticed something strange with her fingertips.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It was then that she finally noticed a strange sensation on her fingertips.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......As she did, she finally noticed something strange with her fingertips.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Foi quando ela finalmente percebeu uma estranha sensação em seus dedos.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这时，缘寿才终于，注意到了指尖上有什么不对。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JP]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): [=PT]

Umineko Project (UP): Somehow, Ange's fingertips were stained red with blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Somehow, Ange's fingertips had been stained red with blood.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De alguma maneira, os dedos de Ange estavam manchados de sangue.

Umineko Project (UP): She let out a short cry and dropped the key that she had just removed from the keyhole.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She let out a short cry, and the key slipped out and fell to the ground.
PC Japanese (JP): 短い悲鳴とともに、抜いた鍵を落としてしまう。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela gritou brevemente e largou a chave que havia acabado de remover da fechadura.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Emise un piccolo grido, e la chiave scivolò e cadde a terra.

Steam (ST): She finally realized. In the darkness, she hadn't noticed before. The black cat's key...was covered with blood...
Umineko Project (UP): She finally realized. In the darkness, she hadn't noticed before.{n}The black cat's key......was covered with blood......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She finally realized. In the darkness, she hadn't noticed before. The black cat's key......was covered with blood......
PC Japanese (JP): ようやく気付く。薄暗闇なので気付かなかった。黒猫の鍵は、……血でべっとりと汚れていたのだ……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ようやく気付く。薄暗闇なので気付かなかった。{n}黒猫の鍵は、……血でべっとりと汚れていたのだ……。
Russian (RU): Энджи наконец поняла. Из‐за темноты она не заметила раньше.{n}Ключ чёрной кошки...... был в крови......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela finalmente percebeu. Na escuridão; ela ainda não havia percebido.{n}A chave do gato preto......estava coberta de sangue......

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Finalmente capì. Nell'oscurità, non se n'era accorta. La chiave del gatto nero... era ricoperta di sangue...

Umineko Project (UP): ......The emotions that had gone numb in Ange sprang back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……縁寿の、麻痺していた感情が蘇る。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Le emozioni che si erano assopite in Ange riemersero.

Umineko Project (UP): A terrified scream rang out through the dark hallway......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 还有，………尸体。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E... c'erano dei cadaveri.

Steam (ST): Krauss and Natsuhi's corpses lay sprawled on the floor...
Umineko Project (UP): Krauss and Natsuhi's corpses lay sprawled on the floor......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss and Natsuhi's corpses lay sprawled on the floor......
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼と夏妃の死体が、無残に転がっている……。
Russian (RU): Трупы Нацухи и Краусса лежали распластавшись на полу......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os corpos de Krauss e Natsuhi estavam esparramados pelo chão......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼和夏妃的屍體，淒慘地倒在那裡……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼和夏妃的尸体，凄惨地倒在那里……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I cadaveri di Krauss e Natsuhi giacevano sul pavimento...

Steam (ST): Very shortly, Ange will step into this room. She will then scream in terror once more...
Umineko Project (UP): Very shortly, Ange will step into this room.{n}She will then scream in terror once more......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Very shortly, Ange will step into this room. She will then scream in terror once more......
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿はもうじき、この部屋に踏み入るだろう。そして再び、恐怖の悲鳴を叫ぶこととなるのだ……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 縁寿はもうじき、この部屋に踏み入るだろう。{n}そして再び、恐怖の悲鳴を叫ぶこととなるのだ……。
Russian (RU): Скоро Энджи шагнёт в эту комнату.{n}И тогда снова закричит от ужаса......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Muito em breve, Ange adentraria o quarto.{n}Ela mais uma vez gritaria aterrorizada......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽很快就會，踏入這個房間的吧。{n}之後會再次，因恐怖而發出悲鳴……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿很快就会，踏入这个房间的吧。{n}之后会再次，因恐怖而发出悲鸣……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tra non molto, Ange entrerà in questa stanza. Quindi urlerà per la paura ancora una volta...

Steam (ST): And it isn't limited to the dining hall and Natsuhi's room.
Umineko Project (UP): And it isn't just the dining hall and Natsuhi's room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And it wasn't just the dining hall and Natsuhi's room.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてそれは、食堂と夏妃の部屋だけのことではない。
Russian (RU): Не только столовая и комната Нацухи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E não era apenas a sala de jantar e o quarto de Natsuhi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，還不僅是餐廳和夏妃的房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，还不仅是餐厅和夏妃的房间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E non si trattava solo della sala da pranzo e della stanza di Natsuhi.

Steam (ST): In the stormy rose garden, ...Shannon's tragic corpse lies exposed.
Umineko Project (UP): In the stormy rose garden, .........Shannon's corpse lies exposed to the rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the stormy rose garden......Shannon's corpse lay exposed to the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): 風雨の薔薇庭園では、………紗音が無残な骸を晒している。
Russian (RU): В бурном розарии...... под дождём лежал труп Шаннон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No tempestuoso jardim de rosas, .........o corpo de Shannon estava exposto à chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 風雨中的玫瑰庭園裡，………紗音淒慘地曝屍於此。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 风雨中的玫瑰庭园里，………纱音凄惨地曝尸于此。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nel giardino di rose percosso dalla tempesta... il cadavere di Shannon giaceva esposto alla pioggia.

Steam (ST): ...Partway down the path to the rose garden...is Jessica's corpse.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Partway down the path to the rose garden...is Jessica's corpse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Partway down the path to the rose garden...was Jessica's corpse.
PC Japanese (JP): ……薔薇の小道の途中には、朱志香の死体。
Russian (RU): ......На пути к розарию... был труп Джессики.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......No caminho do jardim de rosas...o corpo de Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……玫瑰庭園的小路當中，有朱志香的屍體。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……玫瑰庭园的小路当中，有朱志香的尸体。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nelle vicinanze della strada per il giardino di rose... c'era il cadavere di Jessica.

Steam (ST): When Ange finds that, she'll probably dash crying and screaming into the guesthouse.
Umineko Project (UP): When Ange finds that, she'll probably dash crying and screaming into the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Ange finds that, she'll probably dash crying and screaming into the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): それらを見つけた縁寿は、きっと泣き叫びながらゲストハウスへ駆け込むだろう。
Russian (RU): Обнаружив их, Энджи плача и крича бросится в домик для гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Ange os encontrasse, ela provavelmente sairia gritando e chorando na direção da casa de hóspedes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 發現這些的緣壽，一定會邊哭邊奔向賓館的吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 发现这些的缘寿，一定会边哭边奔向宾馆的吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando Ange li troverà, probabilmente correrà piangendo e urlando fino alla casa degli ospiti.

Steam (ST): And...death awaits her inside the guesthouse as well.
Umineko Project (UP): And......death awaits her inside the guesthouse as well.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And...death awaits her inside the guesthouse as well.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてゲストハウスにも、……死が待ち構えている。
Russian (RU): Но... смерть ждёт её и там.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E......dentro da casa de hóspedes, a morte também aguardava por ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之後在賓館裡，……死亡也等待著她來臨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之后在宾馆里，……死亡也等待着她来临。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E... la morte la aspetterà anche lì.

Steam (ST): Just inside the front door...is Nanjo's corpse.
Umineko Project (UP): Just inside the front door...is Nanjo's corpse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just inside the front door...is Nanjo's corpse.
PC Japanese (JP): 入っていきなりの玄関には、南條の死体が横たわっている。
Russian (RU): Прямо у парадной двери... труп Нанджо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Logo atrás da porta da frente...o corpo de Nanjo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一進門就能在玄關看到，南條的屍體倒在那裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一进门就能在玄关看到，南条的尸体倒在那里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Proprio di fronte alla porta d'ingresso... c'è il cadavere di Nanjo.

Steam (ST): In the servant room nearby, even Gohda and Kumasawa lie dead.
Umineko Project (UP): In the servant room nearby, even Gohda and Kumasawa lie dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the servant room nearby, even Gohda and Kumasawa lie dead.
PC Japanese (JP): その脇の使用人室には、郷田と熊沢の死体まで。
Russian (RU): В комнате слуг неподалёку даже Года и Кумасава лежат мёртвыми.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na sala dos serviçais nas proximidades, descansavam os corpos de Gohda e Kumasawa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那旁邊的傭人室中，還有鄉田和熊澤的屍體。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那旁边的佣人室中，还有乡田和熊泽的尸体。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nella stanza dei domestici lì vicina, anche Gohda e Kumasawa giacevano morti.

Steam (ST): ...The total number of corpses...is 13.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The total number of corpses...is thirteen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The total number of corpses...is 13.
PC Japanese (JP): ……死体の数は、１３体。
Russian (RU): ......Общее число трупов — 13.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O número total de corpos era...treze.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……屍體的數量是，13。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……尸体的数量是，13。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il numero totale di cadaveri... è 13.

Steam (ST): A full 13 corpses are waiting for Ange.
Umineko Project (UP): A full thirteen corpses are waiting for Ange.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A full 13 corpses are waiting for Ange.
PC Japanese (JP): １３もの死が、縁寿を待っている。
Russian (RU): Энджи ждёт целых 13 трупов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um total de treze cadáveres aguardavam por Ange.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 13 人的死，正等待著緣壽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 13 人的死，正等待着缘寿。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ben 13 cadaveri aspettavano Ange.

Steam (ST): They wait in the mansion and the guesthouse on this desolate Rokkenjima... for Ange, exposed to the wind and rain and tormented by thunder, to find them...
Umineko Project (UP): They wait in the mansion and the guesthouse on this desolate Rokkenjima......for Ange, exposed to the wind and rain and tormented by thunder, to find them......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They wait in the mansion and the guesthouse on this desolate Rokkenjima... for Ange, exposed to the wind and rain and tormented by thunder, to find them......
PC Japanese (JP): 誰もいない六軒島で、屋敷でゲストハウスで、……風雨に晒され、雷鳴に苛まれながら、縁寿が哀れみに来てくれるのを待っている……。
Russian (RU): Они ждут в особняке и домике для гостей на уединённой Роккенджиме, ......пока Энджи, выбежавшая под ветер и дождь и замученная громом, не найдёт их......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles aguardavam na mansão e na casa de hóspedes desta Rokkenjima desolada......esperando por Ange, expostos ao vento e a chuva e atormentados por trovões, para que ela os encontrasse......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這無一活人的六軒島上，大屋中賓館中，……置於風雨之中，被雷鳴所折磨，等待著緣壽來為他們感到悲痛……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这无一活人的六轩岛上，大屋中宾馆中，……置于风雨之中，被雷鸣所折磨，等待着缘寿来为他们感到悲痛……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Attendono nella villa e nella casa degli ospiti su questa desolata Rokkenjima... Ange, esposti al vento e alla pioggia e tormentati dal tuono, affinché li trovi...
